raw_text:
Safin slumps to shock Dubai loss
 
 Marat Safin suffered a shock loss to unseeded Nicolas Kiefer in round one of the Dubai Tennis Championships.
 
 Playing his first match since winning the Australian Open, Safin showed some good touches but was beaten 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 by the in-form Kiefer. The German got on top in the first-set tie-break, striking a sweet forehand to win the first point against serve. And he maintained the momentum early in the second set, breaking the Russian with the help of an inspired volley. Spain's Feliciano Lopez lined up a second round clash with Andre Agassi by beating Thailand's Paradorn Srichaphan. Lopez, who lost in three sets to Roger Federer in last year's final, won 6-2 3-6 6-3. Former champion Fabrice Santoro of France was beaten 6-3 6-0 by sixth seeded Russian Nikolay Davydenko. There were also wins for two other Russians, Igor Andreev and seventh seed Mikhail Youzhny.

Fabrice Santoro was beaten by Nikolay Davydenko. Igor Andreev and Mikhail Youzhny won their matches, progressing through the tournament.

In the second round, Fabrice Santoro beat Spain's Feliciano Lopez 6-3 6-0, but he was outplayed by another Russian player named Andre Agassi, who defeated him in the third round 6-2 3-6 6-3.

Safin showed some good touches but was outplayed 7-6 (7-2), 6-4. Lopez defeated Paradorn Srichaphan and won a second round match, while Santoro and Davydenko also lost their matches to other Russians.
opencoder:1.5b:
Safin slumps to shock the Dubai loss.

Marat Safin suffered a loss to Nicolas Kiefer in the Dubai Tennis Championships. Playing his first match since winning the Australian Open, he showed some good touches but was beaten 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 by the versatile Kiefer. The German got on top in the first-set tie-break, breaking the Russian with the help of an innovative volley. Spain's Feliciano Lopez lined up a clash against Andre Agassi to win the first point. He maintained momentum early in the second set, breaking the Russian with a heartfelt serve. And he maintained the momentum even further in the third set, which introduced a playful double-serve swing. The French, on the other hand, won 6-2 3-6 6-3 by losing three sets to Roger Federer in last year's final. Former champion Fabrice Santoro of France was beaten 6-3 6-0 by sixth seeded Russian Nikolay Davydenko. There were also wins for two other players, Igor Andreev and seventh seeded player Mikhail Youzhny.
smollm:1.7b: Safin slumped to shock Dubai loss
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, let's tackle this query step by step. The user has provided a text about tennis players and their matches in the Dubai Tennis Championships. They want a summary that captures key ideas and details while outputting only the plain text.

First, I need to read through each sentence carefully to identify the main points. The first sentence mentions Safin slipping into shock because he lost to Nicolas Kiefer in round one of the Dubai tournament. That's the primary event to highlight.

Next, looking at the stats and outcomes: Safin played his first match since winning the Australian Open, which is a good detail about how he felt entering the event. His performance was solid initially—he broke serves in both set 1 and set 2—but ultimately fell short 7-6 to Kiefer.

I should note that Kiefer won with two sets lost, which gives context on his strength. Also, the serving stats show Agassi's dominance in the future, which is a key takeaway for someone interested in tennis predictions or strategies.

Moving on, the summary also mentions other important matches: Feliciano Lopez beat Paradorn Srichaphan, which is another high-scoring victory by a strong player. The French had to deal with Roger Federer last year, so that's an interesting angle about his history and the players fighting for titles there.

Fabrice Santoro lost to Davydenko, who was a sixth seed, but both victories are notable. This suggests a competitive bracket where top seeds face each other in later rounds. Also, Igor Andreev is another solid player in that mix, which adds more detail about the field.

The user wants only the summary in plain text without explanations or formatting. So I need to make sure every important point is included concisely, covering all key details from the original text without adding any extra information.
</think>

Safin slipped into shock because he fell 7-6 (7-2) against Nicolas Kiefer in round one of the Dubai Tennis Championships. He broke serves in both set 1 and set 2 but was ultimately beaten 6-4 by Kiefer, who won with two sets lost and held a strong serve.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Russian tennis player, Marat Safin, suffered a shock loss to unsseed Nicolas Kieme during the Dubai Tennis Championships. While playing his first match since winning the Australian Open in January, Safin showed some good touches but was defeated by Kieme, who won 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 in the first set tie-break. Safin maintained momentum early in the second set with a well-executed volley, while Kieme's opponent, Spain's Feliciano Lopez, faced a second-round loss against Andre Agassi. Despite losing in three sets to Federer last year, Lopez won 6-2 3-6 6-3 over Thailand's Paradorn Srikaphan. The Frenchman Fabrice Soussa was beaten 6-3 6-0 by Russian Nikolay Davydenko, while in other news, two other Russians, Igor Andreev and seventh seed Mikhaiil Youzhny, won their matches as well.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Marat Safin suffered a shock loss to unseeded Nicolas Kiefer in the Dubai Tennis Championships. In the first set tie-break, Safin was on the back foot as Kiefer broke him with a powerful forehand and took the lead. However, Safin bounced back in the second set, breaking Kiefer twice with his trademark volley from close range. Despite that, Kiefer secured victory 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 to claim his maiden victory at the event.
